generalInfo:
This self-drive adventure takes you through some of the country’s most iconic and varied landscapes, from the towering red dunes of Sossusvlei to the wild Atlantic coast at Swakopmund, the rugged beauty of Damaraland, and Etosha’s wildlife-rich plains. Each region offers something unique, and the joy is as much in the journey as the destinations themselves.

With excellent roads, a reliable 4x4 and our support throughout, this is one of the safest and most spectacular ways to explore Africa independently. You’ll stay in a mix of characterful lodges and guesthouses, with optional activities like rhino tracking, hot air ballooning and expert-led walks.

Perfect for couples, friends or families with older children, this is a trip for those who want flexibility, freedom and a front-row seat to Namibia’s wild, cinematic beauty.

dayInfo.description: Land in Windhoek and enjoy a private transfer to Zannier Omaanda, your welcome to Namibia. Relax in luxurious thatched accommodation, unwind by the heated infinity pool, and meet your 4×4 and guide for a thorough briefing.

Your journey truly begins with a scenic drive north to Otjiwa Game Reserve. Check into Eagle’s Rest, where you can opt for a gentle nature walk or rhino-tracking, before savouring a sundowner overlooking the bushveld.

Continue north to the edge of Etosha National Park. Your next two nights are spent at Onguma Trails Camp, a relaxed and atmospheric base with direct access to the park. Arrive in time for a leisurely afternoon and your first chance to spot wildlife on a guided drive or from camp.

Today is all about wildlife. Drive yourself or join a guided safari to explore the salt pans and waterholes of eastern Etosha, where elephant, giraffe, lion and rhino often gather. Return to camp for dinner under the stars and stories by the fire.

Make your way west through Etosha, a scenic drive that offers incredible wildlife viewing along the way. The western sector is less visited and feels more remote, with a different mix of landscapes and species. It’s a full day of safari at your own pace.

Spend the day exploring at your leisure. Visit secluded waterholes, look for predators on the move, and enjoy the thrill of spotting wildlife without the crowds. Optional game drives with expert trackers are available if you’d like more in-depth insights.

Leave Etosha and head south-west into the heart of Damaraland, a land of rugged mountains, ancient riverbeds and extraordinary rock formations. The drive is beautiful, with changing colours and textures around every bend. Arrive in time for a quiet evening in the wild.

Join expert guides to track desert-adapted elephants or rhinos in the dry river valleys – a real highlight of the trip. You can also visit Twyfelfontein, home to some of Africa’s finest prehistoric rock engravings. The silence and space here are unforgettable.

Travel west through vast desert plains towards the Atlantic. Pause at Cape Cross seal colony or eerie shipwrecks along the coast before continuing to Swakopmund – a quirky seaside town that feels worlds away from the desert. Stay in a guesthouse with time to explore the town.

Today is yours to choose. Head out on a catamaran cruise or kayak among seals in Walvis Bay, take a scenic flight over the dunes, or go quad biking across the coastal desert. Swakopmund also offers great seafood, art galleries and German colonial charm.

Head south to the Namib–Naukluft region, home to some of Namibia’s most iconic scenery. Stop in the tiny outpost of Solitaire before continuing to your lodge near Sesriem. The journey itself is full of moments to pause and photograph the shifting sands.

Rise early for a sunrise climb up the dunes of Sossusvlei – the light is extraordinary at this hour. Walk through the eerie white clay pan of Deadvlei, explore Sesriem Canyon, or take an optional hot air balloon flight for a truly memorable view from above.

Begin your return journey to Windhoek, taking in the stark beauty of the desert one last time. Arrive back in the capital and return your vehicle. Depending on your flight, you may have time to explore town or enjoy a final dinner.

Transfer to the airport for your onward flight home. After two weeks of open roads, wild landscapes and unforgettable wildlife, leave Namibia with a camera full of memories and a head full of stories.
